news_header: Asian stock exchanges showed upward trends, influenced by positive news from China, while the US market awaits employment reports.
news_original_title: Kiinan pörssit nousussa – Länsimarkkinoilla odotetaan USA:n työllisyysraporttia
news_text: Asian stock exchanges ended the week positively, with the CSI 300 index in China up 1.6% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng rising by 0.8%. The Hang Seng has seen an annual increase of over a third. In Japan, the Nikkei index fell by 0.6%. On Wall Street, there was little movement as markets remained indecisive. Amazon reported better-than-expected results but saw a drop in shares due to weaker guidance. The company struggles to meet AI demand despite significant investments. Investors are awaiting US employment reports, with expectations of 175,000 new jobs in January, following a December increase of 256,000. European markets will also focus on German industrial production data.
